author: Stunning details in Lamar Odom brothel incident
title: Tennis - Tennis: Federer's Slams record not impossible, says Djokovic
text:
Tennis - Tennis: Federer's Slams record not impossible, says Djokovic AFP 1 day ago Â© Provided by AFP Novak Djokovic of Serbia waves to the crowd after winning his men's singles second round match against Martin Klizan of Slovakia at the Shanghai Masters tennis tournament in Shanghai on October 14, 2015. AFP PHOTO / GREG BAKER Novak Djokovic on Wednesday said taking out Roger Federer's record of 17 Grand Slam titles was one of his main motivations as he looks to prolong his stay at the top of men's tennis.
AdChoices "Nothing is impossible. I have that kind of mindset. I know that it's still a long way to break his record," Djokovic, 28, and who has ten Slams said at the Shanghai Masters, after cruising past Martin Klizan 6-2, 6-1.
"But people even mentioning and talking about it, obviously it flatters me. I'm honored to have such compliments."
Pete Sampras' record of 14 majors stood for seven years before Federer surpassed it in 2009.
AFP
